children.title: Is this an inspection for a hospital?
children.hint: The report created will be Joint Commission layout.

children.title: Inspection or Cleaning?
children.hint: Select the type of service provided.

children.title: Inspection Frequency
children.hint: Select the frequency of inspection being performed

children.title: Hazard Area
children.hint: NFPA 17A 7.2.2(8) The hazard has not changed, including replacement, modification, and relocation of protected equipment.

children.title: System Size
children.hint: Enter system dimensions.

children.title: Number of Cylinders
children.hint: Number of cylinders?

children.title: Cylinder Agent
children.hint: Cylinder type

children.title: Expellant Gas Type
children.hint: Expellant gas type

children.title: Hood Size
children.hint: NFPA 96 5.2 Hood Size. Hoods shall be sized and configured to provide for the capture and removal of grease-laden vapors.

children.title: Duct Size
children.hint: Duct size

children.title: Manufacture Date
children.hint: List manufacturer of system

children.title: Kitchen system is tied into the Fire Alarm system
children.hint: NFPA 17A 5.2.1.9 The extinguishing system shall be connected to the fire alarm system, if provided, in accordance with the requirements of NFPA 72 so that the actuation of the extinguishing system will sound the fire alarm. NFPA 96 10.6.2 Where a fire alarm signaling system is serving the occupancy where the extinguishing system is located, the activation of the automatic fire-extinguishing system shall activate the fire alarm signaling system.

children.title: Seals intact with no signs of tampering?
children.hint: NFPA 17A 7.2.2(3) The tamper indicators and seals are intact.

children.title: Hazard appears unchanged since last visit?
children.hint: NFPA 17A 7.3.3.1(1) A check to see that the hazard has not changed.

children.title: Alarm monitoring company notified before system activated?
children.hint: Was the alarm monitoring entity notified before system activated?

children.title: Cooking Appliances
children.hint: Listing of cooking appliances under kitchen suppression

children.title: Securely mounted
children.hint: NFPA 17A 4.9.2 All extinguishing agent storage containers shall be examined to ensure that they are fastened securely to their mounting brackets.

children.title: Pressure gauge operable
children.hint: NFPA 17A 7.2.2 (6) The pressure gauge(s), if provided, has been inspected physically or electronically to ensure it is in the operable range.

children.title: Pressure Reading
children.hint: Enter Pressure

children.title: Corrosion & damage free
children.hint: NFPA 17A  7.3.3.2 Where maintenance of any wet chemical containers reveals conditions such as, but not limited to, corrosion or pitting in excess of the manufacturer’s limits; structural damage; fire damage; or repairs by soldering, welding, or brazing, the affected container shall be hydrostatically tested in accordance with Section 8.5 or replaced in accordance with the instructions of the manufacturer or the listing agency.

children.title: Correct Volume of Agent
children.hint: NFPA 17A  7.3.3.1  Maintenance shall include the following: (2) An examination of all detectors, the expellant gas container(s), the agent container(s), the releasing devices, the piping, the hose assemblies, the nozzles, the signals, all auxiliary equipment, and the liquid level of all nonpressurized wet chemical containers

children.title: Volume of Agent
children.hint: Enter agent volume

children.title: Piping not obstructed
children.hint: NFPA 17A  7.3.3.1  Maintenance shall include the following: (3) The test outlined in 8.3.3.1.1 to verify that the agent distribution piping is not obstructed

children.title: Hydro Test
children.hint: NFPA 17A  7.5.1  The following parts of wet chemical extinguishing systems shall be subjected to a hydrostatic pressure test at intervals not exceeding 12 years:  (1) Wet chemical containers  (2) Auxiliary pressure containers  (3) Hose assemblies

children.title: Last Hydro Date
children.hint: Enter last hydro date

children.title: Cartridge undamaged, weight and pressure correct.
children.hint: NFPA 17A  7.3.3.1  Maintenance shall include the following: (2) An examination of all detectors, the expellant gas container(s), the agent container(s), the releasing devices, the piping, the hose assemblies, the nozzles, the signals, all auxiliary equipment, and the liquid level of all nonpressurized wet chemical containers

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Heat detector other than fusible links, free of damage,clean & functions properly?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 11.2.7 Fixed temperature-sensing elements other than the fusible metal alloy type shall be permitted to remain continuously in service, provided they are inspected and cleaned or replaced if necessary in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions, every 12 months or more frequently to ensure proper operation of the system.

children.title: Proper number and placement of detectors/links?
children.hint: NFPA 96 15.2(2) At least one fusible link or heat detector shall be installed within each exhaust duct opening in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing. NFPA 17A 5.6.1.4 At least one fusible link or heat detector shall be installed within each exhaust duct opening in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing.

children.title: Replaced fusible links with proper temperature rating?
children.hint: NFPA 17A - 5.6.1.4 At least one fusible link or heat detector shall be installed within each exhaust duct opening in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing. NFPA 96 - 11.2.4 Fusible links of the metal alloy type and automatic sprinklers of the metal alloy type shall be replaced at least semiannually.

children.title: Number of links replaced? (also indicate temperature ratings)
children.hint: Number of links replaced? (also indicate temperature ratings)

children.title: Mechanical detection operates properly?
children.hint: Mechanical detection link line tested and found to operate properly?

children.title: System operated/tested by manual activation?
children.hint: NFPA 17A 7.3.3. All wet chemical systems shall be tested, which shall include operation of the detection system signals and releasing devices, including manual stations and other associated equipment.

children.title: Remote manual pull at proper height, in path of egress, unobstructed and clearly identifying the hazard protected
children.hint: NFPA 96 10.5.1.1 At least one manual actuation device shall be located in a means of egress or at a location acceptable to the AHJ.

children.title: Remote manual pull tested and operated properly?
children.hint: NFPA 96 11.2.2 All actuation and control components, including remote manual pull stations, mechanical and electrical devices, detectors, and actuators, shall be tested for proper operation during the inspection in accordance with the manufacturer’s procedures.

children.title: Manual actuators unobstructed
children.hint: NFPA 17A  8.2.2  At a minimum, the inspection shall include verification of the following:  (2) The manual actuators are unobstructed.

children.title: Audio/visual device(s) installed and operating properly?
children.hint: NFPA 96 10.6.1 Upon activation of an automatic fire-extinguishing system, an audible alarm or visual indicator shall be provided to show that the system has activated.

children.title: Alarm monitoring entity, if used, received alarm
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 10.6.2 Where a fire alarm signaling system is serving the occupancy where the extinguishing system is located, the activation of the automatic fire-extinguishing system shall activate the fire alarm signaling system.

children.title: Piping & conduit securely bracketed?
children.hint: NFPA 17A - 6.4.2.2 It shall be verified that piping supports are securely fastened. NFPA 17A - 7.3.3.1 Maintenance shall include the following: (2) An examination of ...piping, hose assemblies...

children.title: Correct type and # of nozzle(s) properly positioned
children.hint: NFPA 17A - 7.3.3 At least semiannually and after any system activation, maintenance shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer's design, installation, and maintenance manual. 7.3.3.1 Maintenance shall include the following: (2) An examination of all detectors, the expellant gas container(s), the agent container(s), releasing devices, piping, hose assemblies, nozzles, signals, all auxiliary equipment, and the liquid level of all nonpressurized wet chemical containers.

children.title: Nozzles inspected and found to be clear of visible obstructions?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 10.2.7.3 The addition of obstructions to spray patterns from the cooking appliance nozzle(s) such as baffle plates, shelves, or any modification shall not be permitted.

children.title: Nozzle caps or seals in place and replaced as required?
children.hint: NFPA 17A 7.2.2(7) The nozzle blowoff caps, where provided, are intact and undamaged.

children.title: Number of Caps/Seals replaced
children.hint: Enter # of caps and seals replaced

children.title: Agent distribution piping blown through with dry air or nitrogen to verify no obstruction
children.hint: (UL EX3470) & NFPA 17A - 7.4.3 After any discharge, the system piping shall be flushed and blown out with dry air or nitrogen in accordance with the procedures detailed in the manufacturer's design, installation, and maintenance manual.

children.title: Gas shutoff valve works properly, if applicable?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 10.4.3 Any gas appliance not requiring protection but located under ventilating equipment where protected appliances are located shall be automatically shut off upon activation of the extinguishing system.

children.title: Valve Type
children.hint: Select type of fuel shutoff in place

children.title: Automatic shutoff devices shut down sources of fuel/power to cooking equipment system?
children.hint: NFPA 96 10.4.1 Upon activation of any fire-extinguishing system for a cooking operation, all sources of fuel and electrical power that produce heat to all equipment requiring protection by that system shall automatically shut off. NFPA 17A 4.4.4.1 On actuation of any cooking equipment fire extinguishing system, all sources of fuel and electric power that produce heat to all equipment protected by the system shall be shut down.

children.title: All gas/electric appliances shut down upon system activation?
children.hint: NFPA 96 10.4.3 Any gas appliance not requiring protection but located under ventilating equipment where protected appliances are located shall be automatically shut off upon activation of the extinguishing system. NFPA 17A 4.4.4.2 Gas appliances not requiring protection but located under the same ventilation equipment shall also be shut off.

children.title: Exhaust fans continue to run upon system activation
children.hint: NFPA 17A 4.4.4.7 A hood exhaust fan(s) shall continue to operate after the extinguishing system has been activated unless fan shutdown is required by a listed component of the ventilation system or by the design of the extinguishing system. NFPA 96 - 8.2.3.1 A hood exhaust fan(s) shall continue to operate after the extinguishing system has been activated unless fan shutdownis required by a listed component of the ventilation system or by the design of the extinguishing system. 8.2.3.2 The hood exhaust fan shall start upon activation of the extinguishing system if the exhaust fan and all cooking equipment served by the fan have been shut down, unless fan shutdown is required by a listed component of the ventilation system or by the listing of the extinguishing system.

children.title: Return air fans shut down upon system activation?
children.hint: NFPA 17A 4.4.4.7.1 When the fire-extinguishing system activates, makeup air supplied internally to a hood shall be shut off. NFPA 96 - 8.3.2 When the fire-extinguishing system activates, makeup air supplied internally to a hood shall be shut off.

children.title: Manual reset working properly?
children.hint: NFPA 17A - 4.4.4.6 Shutoff devices shall require manual resetting prior to fuel or power being restored. NFPA 96 - 10.4.4 Shutoff devices shall require manual reset.

children.title: Portable extinguisher of proper type mounted with sign/placard?
children.hint: NFPA 17A 4.4.3.6 A placard shall be conspicuously placed near each Class K extinguisher that states that the fire protection system shall be activated prior to using the fire extinguisher. NFPA 96 - 10.9.2 Class K fire extinguishers shall be provided for cooking appliance hazards that involve combustible cooking media (vegetable oils and animal oils and fats). NFPA 96 - 10.2.2 A placard shall be conspicuously placed near each Class K extinguisher that states that the fire protection system shall be activated prior to using the fire extinguisher.

children.title: Required service performed on extinguisher?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 10.9.5 Portable fire extinguishers shall be maintained in accordance with NFPA 10.

children.title: Interlocks in place and operating properly?
children.hint: NFPA 96  14.3.1  The recirculating system shall be provided with interlocks of all critical components and operations as indicated in 14.3.2 through 14.3.4 such that, if any of these interlocks are interrupted, the cooking appliance will not be able to operate.   14.3.2 All closure panels encompassing airflow sections shall have interlocks to ensure that the panels are in place and fully sealed.  14.3.3 Each filter component (grease and odor) shall have an interlock to prove the component is in place.   14.3.4.1 Each ESP shall have a sensor to prove its performance is as designed, with no interruption of the power to exceed 2 minutes.  14.3.4.2 The sensor shall be a manual reset device or circuit.

children.title: Proper separation between fryers & flame?
children.hint: NFPA 96 12.1.2.4 All deep-fat fryers shall be installed with at least a 406 mm (16 in.) space between the fryer and surface flames from adjacent cooking equipment.

children.title: Proper clearance from cooking surface to filters?
children.hint: NFPA 96 14.5.3 Filters shall be a minimum of 1.2 m (4 ft) above the appliance cooking surface.

children.title: Grease buildup inspection; cleaning required?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 11.6.1 If, upon inspection, the exhaust system is found to be contaminated with deposits from grease-laden vapors, the contaminated portions of the exhaust system shall be cleaned by a properly trained, qualified, and certified person(s) acceptable to the authority having jurisdiction. 11.6.1.1.3 Where a measured depth of 2000 µm (0.078 in.) is observed, the surfaces shall be cleaned in accordance with 11.6.1. 11.6.1.1.4 Where a measured depth of 3175 µm (0.125 in.) is observed in a fan housing, the surfaces shall be cleaned in accordance with 11.6.1.

children.title: Measurement
children.hint: Enter as a decimal with unit of measurement included.

children.title: Observable hood and duct penetrations sealed with a weld or a UL listed device?
children.hint: NFPA 96 5.1.5 Penetrations shall be permitted to be sealed by devices that are listed for such use and whose presence does not detract from the hood’s or duct’s structural integrity.

children.title: Test adapters/links, pins, etc, removed from system?
children.hint: Test adapters/links, pins, etc removed from system?

children.title: Temperature sensing detection link line has proper tensioning
children.hint: Detection link line has proper tensioning?

children.title: Control head reset?
children.hint: Ensure control head reset.

children.title: Cartridges reinstalled?
children.hint: Ensure cartridges reinstalled.

children.title: Fuel sources and power restored?
children.hint: Fuel sources and power restored?

children.title: Pilot lights supplied by gas valve,if present, reset?
children.hint: Reset Pilot lights supplied by gas valve.

children.title: Microswitch/relays reset - electrical appliances on?
children.hint: Ensure microswitch/relays reset - electrical appliances on.

children.title: Filters and baffles in place?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 11.6.13 When an exhaust system is inspected or cleaned, a certificate showing the name of the servicing company, the name of the person performing the work, and the date of inspection or cleaning shall be maintained on the premises.

children.title: System operational and seals in place?
children.hint: System operational and seals in place at end of testing.

children.title: Tandem system reset and operational?
children.hint: Ensure tandem system is reset and operational.

children.title: Inspection tag affixed to system?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 11.6.13 When an exhaust system is inspected or cleaned, a certificate showing the name of the servicing company, the name of the person performing the work, and the date of inspection or cleaning shall be maintained on the premises.

children.title: Alarm monitoring company notified of completion of inspection?
children.hint: Notify alarm monitoring company at completion of inspection.

children.title: Instructions for manual operation posted in the kitchen area
children.hint: NFPA 96 11.1.4.3 Instructions for manually operating the fire extinguishing system shall be posted conspicuously in the kitchen and shall be reviewed with employees by the management.

children.title: System meets UL300 standard?
children.hint: NFPA 96 - 10.2.3 Automatic fire-extinguishing systems shall comply with ANSI/UL 300 or other equivalent standards and shall be installed in accordance with the requirements of the listing.

children.title: Overall condition of the system at end of test
children.hint: Indicate if the system passed or failed.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Overall grease condition of system?
children.hint: Grease condition of hood system

children.title: System free of missing light bulbs or covers?
children.hint: Indicate if any light bulbs or covers are missing.

children.title: System free of missing or damaged filters?
children.hint: Indicate if there are any missing or damaged filters

children.title: Lockout/Tagout performed?
children.hint: NFPA 96 12.6.3  At the start of the cleaning process, electrical switches that could be activated accidentally shall be locked out.

children.title: Exhaust fans operational?
children.hint: Indicate if exhaust fans are operational

children.title: Hood lights working?
children.hint: Indicate if hood lights are working.

children.title: Appliances disconnected?
children.hint: Indicate if appliances were disconnected prior to cleaning.

children.title: Horizontal ducts cleaned?
children.hint: Indicate if horizontal ducts were cleaned.

children.title: Access panels installed, with proper signage?
children.hint: Indicate if access panels are in place with proper signs.

children.title: Hood light covers cleaned?
children.hint: Indicate if light covers were cleaned.

children.title: Vertical ducts cleaned?
children.hint: Indicate if vertical ducts were cleaned.

children.title: Number of exhaust hoods?
children.hint: Enter # of hoods in area

children.title: Exhaust system free of any visible grease leaks?
children.hint: Indicate if exhaust system is free of visible grease leaks.

children.title: Number of exhaust hoods cleaned?
children.hint: List # of hoods cleaned

children.title: Grease catchment trays cleaned?
children.hint: Indicate if catchment trays cleaned.

children.title: Lockout/Tagout removed?
children.hint: Ensure lockout/tagout is removed.

children.title: Work areas left free of grease, debris, rags, or other material?
children.hint: Were areas left clean, debris removed

children.title: Electrical switches and exhaust components reconnected & operating properly?
children.hint: NFPA 96 12.6.12  When cleaning procedures are completed, all electrical switches and system components shall be returned to an operable state

children.title: Appliances reconnected?
children.hint: NFPA 96 12.6.12  When cleaning procedures are completed, all electrical switches and system components shall be returned to an operable state.

children.title: Compliance certificate dated and placed on hood?
children.hint: NFPA 96 12.6.13 When an exhaust system is inspected or cleaned, a certificate showing the name of the servicing company, the name of the personperforming the work, and the date of inspection or cleaning shall be maintained on the premises.  NFPA 96 12.6.10 When an access panel is removed, a service company label or tag preprinted with the name of the company and giving the date ofinspection or cleaning shall be affixed near the affected access panels.

children.title: Areas inaccessible for cleaning?
children.hint: List any areas that were not cleaned due to inaccessability.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue

"The owner and/or designated representative acknowledges the responsibility of the operating condition of the component parts at the time of this inspection. It is agreed that the inspection service provided by the contractor as prescribed herein is limited to performing a visual inspection and/or routine testing, and any investigation or unscheduled testing, modification, maintenance, repair, etc., of the component parts is not included as part of the inspection work performed. It is further understood that all information contained herein is provided to the best of the knowledge of the party providing such information."
